newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korea kills another Northern infiltrator.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea kills another Northern infiltrator.

text.p: South Korean troops killed another North Korean infiltrator on Monday, bringing to 22 the number of Pyongyang agents shot dead since they came ashore by submarine earlier this month, a defence ministry official said.
"He was killed in a gunfight with South Korean troops," the official said by telephone from the east coast city of Kangnung, near where an estimated 26 North Koreans landed on September 18.
So far 11 infiltrators have been killed by Southern forces, 11 were found dead -- possibly executed by their own colleagues -- and one has been captured alive.
Another three are believed to be still on the run.
Pyongyang has demanded the immediate return of the submarine along with the surviving and dead crew.
